attributes.action: Referendum result can only be overturned by another referendum, not by MPs
attributes.background: When the government gives the people a choice in a referendum that has effect in law, then MPs should not be allowed to overturn the law without another referendum - in order to uphold the principle of democracy consistently. If the UK allows this to happen once, it will set a dangerous precedent.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We can't accept your petition because we aren't sure what action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take.
